meanings.definition: To expose again to something, especially to something harmful or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: After getting over the flu, I didn't want to reexpose myself to any more germs.
meanings.sent2: The doctor warned not to reexpose the skin to the sun after the treatment.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally reexposed my sunburned skin to the hot sun, ouch!
meanings.sent4: She felt like reexposing her fears to the world was a necessary step towards healing.
meanings.sent5: The detective decided to reexpose the evidence to find new clues.

meanings.definition: To subject to exposure again, especially to light or air.
meanings.sent1: The artist needed to reexpose the photograph to develop it further.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reexpose the film to light for the final stage of processing.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally reexposed the film to light, ruining the entire roll.
meanings.sent4: The old painting was reexposed to light, revealing hidden details.
meanings.sent5: The scientist decided to reexpose the sample to different temperatures for testing.
